thread.title: Lucky guess lands Royals fan free tickets to game 1 of ALCS
thread.title_full: Lucky guess lands Royals fan free tickets to game 1 of ALCS - KCTV5

author: Laura McCallister, Multimedia Producer
title: Lucky guess lands Royals fan free tickets to game 1 of ALCS
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - A lucky guess landed long-time Kansas City Royals fans free tickets to game 1 of the American League Championship Series.
Major League Baseball and Royals created a Twitter contest asking fans to guess how many baseballs were in a basket.
A dad from Erie, KS, guessed correctly and was the first to get the right guess in.
David Holland threw his hat in the ring as soon as the picture of the basket full of baseball.
"I looked at it I saw 12 balls across and 12 balls down, 144 gross, that's a good number," Holland said.
He did some quick math with 12 times 12 and viola, 144. His keen eye for counting baseballs paid off.
"I was thinking, 'I won tickets? Really?’ My wife was sitting there, I showed it to her and said ‘I've won tickets!’" Holland said.
His son Adam soon got a call.
“My wife sent me a text and said, ‘You need to call me.’ She said ‘Can you get off work tomorrow?’ I said ‘I guess I can.’ She said ‘You’re going to a ball game.’ I was just stunned,” Adam Holland said.
The tickets meant a lot to David Holland, who’s been a Royals fan since the 1970s.
"Six months old when I brought him to his first game," David Holland said.
Adam Holland has been a fan practically since birth, but neither he nor his father have ever seen a postseason game in person.
"I think it's special. I really think it's special," David Holland said.
"This is going to be a fun time for us after all these years of watching them play," Adam Holland said.
David Holland drove the more than four hour round trip from Erie to Kauffman Stadium.
